intro: Microlicia colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian microlicia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. Microlicia colombiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
